abstract: Twitter so far seems to be avoiding the premature heights of Facebook’s flawed 2012 market debut, the author contends.
snippet: Twitter so far seems to be avoiding the premature heights of Facebook’s flawed 2012 market debut, the author contends.
lead_paragraph: Twitter seems to be avoiding Facebook’s overreach – so far. The microblogging site’s provisional pricing for its initial public offering is $17 to $20 a share. Calculations by Reuters Breakingviews suggest that’s modest by the metrics available, though without profit these require a leap of faith. At least Twitter seems to be avoiding the premature heights of Facebook’s flawed debut last year.
